Today looked like it was going to be like any other. Wake up, shower, get dressed, make breakfast, the usual. For years, you've been taking medication to suppress your illness. When Jack was just 8 years old, he got sick and gave you a rather nasty bug that you called the Gooey Flu. The effect made your body just as weak and malleable as him. Being a single mother, you could risk anything happening to you or your son would be all on his own. You managed to swallow your pride and give your bastard ex-boyfriend (and Jack's father) a call and he's been sending you a supply of medication to combat the Gooey Flu for years. However, there's a problem today. You appear to have run out! Until you get some more, you're going to have to deal with being weak and malleable. However, your devotion to your son is great. Even at your weakened state, you still have responsibilities.

What stage in life is your son at?
1.title: Newly Gooey

11.content:
As you slowly wake from an afternoon nap, you groan loudly. You can't believe that you forgot to reorder your medication. It wasn't even that long ago that little Jack had given you this illness, and you had already let it slip your mind. Rubbing your head as you walk around the house, you struggle to remember your plans for today.

A red cooler catches your eye as you reach the kitchen. "Does Jack have school today?", you ask yourself. Despite your initial hesitation, you put your son back into public school. He had become rather close with a cute, sweet little girl named Marilyn (Mary for short) and the two had become quite an adorable little couple. Jack was safe with her and Barbara's son, Andrew.
If Jack did have school today, then this had to be his lunch. Maybe he forgot to take it with him?

Or maybe you packed it earlier today?
You remember making plans to go out. Maybe the trip to the water park was today? Tina, Barbara, and yourself had all agreed to organize a family trip to Splash Zone at some point. Was that it? You weren't sure if an outing would be a good idea in your current state, especially knowing how much fun Barbara had with you a while back. Tina wasn't aware of your condition, but you weren't sure if you wanted her to find out, either.

Were you planning a picnic?
Jack had been talking about wanting to take Mary on a little date. Despite being such a mama's boy, Jack's personality completely changed when his cute little girlfriend was around, quickly becoming a little gentleman once she was in the room. You were quite proud of teaching him that behavior.

Was it for your own lunch?
You remember that you agreed to babysit Stevie for Barbara. Given how rough the toddler was, you weren't looking forward to that, at least not at your current state.

Maybe you were going to transport something?
You had planned... Well, it was more of a silly idea than anything, to replicate Jack's body mass and use it to create various objects with it. You needed to take it to a research lab, first so that they could study it's properties. Your plan was to get Jack's permission and start up a business selling the soft, malleable material. The whole thing sounded silly now that you thought about it.

What do you remember?

112.content:
[copypasta'd from the original version]

"Momma!" You quickly turn your head to find your son excitedly running out of the room in a pair of white and blue swim trunks. "Hurry up and get changed or we're gonna be late!", he said, bouncing up and down with excitement.

That's right. You were supposed to meet up with Barbara and Tina to take your families out to the water park. In your current state, you knew that you would be quite vulnerable, possibly even more so than Jack. You knew how much Barbara liked to mess with you when you were squishy, and you weren't sure if Tina would have the urge to play with you, but you didn't want to find out. That's not even considering the possibility of getting squished by a stranger. What would become of your son if something happens to you?
But you saw how excited Jack was to go to the water park. He had been looking forward to this all week. You couldn't even think about how upset he would be if you just cancelled the trip without telling him why. You love your son more than anything. To get him excited for a trip with his friends, only to snatch it away for seemingly no reason seemed downright cruel. You decided that you were just going to have to be careful.

"*sigh* Alright, sweetie. Just give me a minute", you said. Within ten minutes, you had changed into a red and white one-piece swimsuit and slipped into a pair of sandals and a sarong and grabbed the cooler, making sure to spray yourself with perfume before heading out.

After about half an hour of driving, you grabbed your son and carried him and the cooler up to the entrance and quickly met up with Tina and Barbara. Jack immediately hopped out of your arms, where Mary quickly squeezed him, the girl wearing a swimsuit very similar to your own. As the children talked, you and your friends discussed the activities you had planned.

"I figure the kids are going to be alright on their own", Barbara said.
"Yeah, the twins can take care of themselves", said Tina. "Jackie ought to be alright with the other kids, huh?", she suggested.

You weren't really sure. On one end, Jack has been trying to become more independent. On the other hand, you felt like your son would be safer with you. He was going to want to spend time with his little girlfriend, though. If safety was a concern, though, you could just tag along with both of them. It was pretty embarrassing to think that you would need a little girl for protection. However, you had come here to spend time with your friends. They might be upset if you preferred to be with your son. Maybe you could use some alone time, though. Your friends would probably understand if you needed some time to yourself.

What will you do?
112.title: Meet Barbara and Tina at the water park.

info.description:
You are Trish Harper, the mother of a small gummy boy named Jack. Unknown to your son, you've been infected with an odd illness called the Gooey Flu that gives your body the same properties as him. You've had this illness since he was 8, but you're able to hold back the illness thanks to some special medication and live a mostly normal life (well, as normal a life as a woman with a short, malleable son can live, anyway). One day, though, your medication runs out and you have only luck to get you through until you're able to get some more. One plus side to your illness is that you have stopped aging.
In your son's teenage years, you've started a company replicating and selling gummy material and many objects that it's made from using samples of Jack's body mass.
You're pretty overprotective of your son (for obvious reasons), often saving him from situations that you think might even have the possibility of something bad happening. Now that you're vulnerable yourself, can you really look out for both your son and yourself?

[edit 10/24/17] a "prequel" of sorts can be found here: https://aryion.com/g4/view/421215

This story takes place at different stages of your son's life.

secondary characters:

Jack Harper:
(child): Your sweet little moppet of a son. Even taking his condition into account, Jack is truly an odd child. Craving independence, but unsure of himself without being by his mama's side. You'd do anything to protect your boy, even if it means putting yourself in harm's way. His adorable looks have already got him a cute little girlfriend named Mary who will grow to become his wife.
(teenager): Even though Jack is a bit more rebellious, he's still a sweet boy. He now spends most of his time with his girlfriend, with whom you've grown to see as a daughter. He has the occasional outburst every now and then, but he's still a bit of a mama's boy. You've found that the girls at school have become much more aggressive toward your son.
(father): Your son has been married to Mary for several years now, and has two beautiful daughters. Even though he's pushing 40, you still like to tease him every now and then (which embarrasses him to no end). While you get along well with the smaller of his daughters, Jillian, you get the feeling that his other daughter, Patricia (partially named after you) is up to something.

Your closest friend since childhood. While the two of you have had your differences in the past, and she may have her faults, but you've always felt like you could rely on Barbara. She's aged quite gracefully compared to most other women and is dedicated to keeping herself fit (though she's gotten a bit flabby).
